page.title: 19Teaching in the East End
page.content: A normal day begins for me at 7.30 when I wake up.I bath,dress and eat;I leave for school at 8.30.It takes 5 minutes by bicycle as I live very near to the school.I go straight to my classroom to prepare for the day,water the plants and feed the 2 white mice,Snowy and Bitsy.The children come in at 9.00 and we go through the register,dinner money etc before settling down to work.This year I have 2nd year juniors and they have been a real pleasure to be with.We have worked from a topic base starting with the playground and working outward to the school ,local streets etc and finishing up with the Domesday Project. In our class we have a good cultural mix-Asian,Turkish,Afro-Caribbean,Arabic Irish and English.I usually stay behind to mount displays,mark work and prepare things until 5.30. Frank MacDonald
